title: Sonal Kumar
text:
I am a third-year PhD candidate in the Neuroscience program at the Jackson Laboratory in collaboration with Tufts University. I am carrying out my thesis research in the Carter lab, where I leverage high-performance computing environments and statistical modeling to analyze integrated multiomics data in order to study Alzheimer’s disease.
Prior to beginning my PhD, I did my masters in Biotechnology and Bioinformatics from the Institute of Bioinformatics and Applied Biotechnology, after getting a bachelor of science in Biotechnology from St. Xavier’s College, Ahmedabad.
On this website, you can find updates on my educational experiences, professional and scientific activities.

title: Sonal Kumar
text:
Research interests

Alzheimer’s disease
Computational biology
Statistical genetics

title: Sonal Kumar
text:
Hobbies
When I am not in the lab, you can find me looking for new (read: easy) trails to hike in Acadia or starting a new creative project. This past year alone, I’ve tried my hand at many crafts, ranging from pottery, gem painting, to crocheting!

title: Education
text:
Doctor of Philosophy in Neuroscience

The Jackson Laboratory (Bar Harbor, ME) and Tufts University, Graduate School of Biomedical Sciences (Boston, MA)

(September 2022 - Present)




Master of Science in Biotechnology and Bioinformatics

Institute of Bioinformatics and Applied Biotechnology (Bengaluru, India)

(August 2020 - July 2022)




Bachelor of Science in Biotechnology

St. Xavier’s College (Ahmedabad, India)

(June 2019 - September 2020)
